intro: Oreocharis guileana, commonly known as the Guile's oreocharis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant blooms that typically appear in late spring. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces showy, white to pale yellow flowers with intricate patterns. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
